t: Psalm 72
The Reign of the Righteous King.
A Psalm of Solomon.
Give*pn the king Your judgments, O God, And*ln Your righteousness to the kingâ€™s son.
May*ln he judge Your people with righteousness And*ln Your afflicted with justice.
Let*ln the mountains bring peace to the people, And*ln the hills, in righteousness.
May*ln he vindicate the afflicted of the people, Save*ln the children of the needy And*ln crush the oppressor.
Let*ln them fear You while the sun endures,*i And*ln as long as the moon, throughout all generations.
May*ln he come down like rain upon the mown grass, Like*ln showers that water the earth.
In*ln his days may the righteous flourish, And*ln abundance of peace till the moon is no more.
May*ln he also rule from sea to sea And*ln from the River to the ends of the earth.
Let*ln the nomads of the desert bow before him, And*ln his enemies lick the dust.
Let*ln the kings of Tarshish and of the islands bring presents; The*ln kings of Sheba and Seba offer gifts.
And*ln let all kings bow down before him, All*ln nations serve him.
For*ln he will deliver the needy when he cries for help, The*ln afflicted also, and him who has no helper.
He*ln will have compassion on the poor and needy, And*ln the lives of the needy he will save.
He*ln will rescue their life from oppression and violence, And*ln their blood will be precious in his sight;
So*ln may he live, and may the gold of Sheba be given to him; And*ln let them pray for him continually; Let*ln them bless him all day long.
May*ln there be abundance of grain in the earth on top of the mountains; Its*ln fruit will wave like the*i cedars*i of*i Lebanon; And*ln may those from the city flourish like vegetation of the earth.
May*ln his name endure forever; May*ln his name increase as long as the sun shines;*i And*ln let men*i bless themselves by him; Let*ln all nations call him blessed.
Blessed*ln be the Lord*s God, the God of Israel, Who*ln alone works wonders.
And*ln blessed be His glorious name forever; And*ln may the whole earth be filled with His glory. Amen,*ln and Amen.
The*ln prayers of David the son of Jesse are ended.
